Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Agency: National Labor Relations Board
NAICS Translation: 561790: Other Services to Buildings and Dwellings
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Akal Security Inc., one of the largest contract security providers in the country, agreed to pay the United States $18 million to resolve allegations that it violated the terms of its contract to provide trained civilian guards at eight U.S. Army bases. According to the settlement, some of the supplied security guards allegedly failed to satisfy weapons qualification requirements and receive other training, and the contractor allegedly failed to satisfy contractual man-hour requirements.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2007/July/07_civ_500.html

Agency: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission
Info Source: https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/12-1-10.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: New Mexico-based Akal Security, Inc., one of the largest providers of security services at federal courthouses, agreed to pay $1,875,000 to resolve allegations that it failed to appropriately conduct firearms testing in the Northern District of California.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/court-security-contractor-pay-18-million-resolve-allegations-guards-did-not-undergo
